snippet: The challenge for New York Road Runners is how to recover from last week’s race cancellation without too much damage to its finances and reputation.
abstract: New York Road Runners chief executive Mary Wittenberg, who has been sharply criticized for her late decision to cancel the New York City Marathon in wake of Hurricane Sandy, faces difficult decisions about how the organization will recover from the weeklong debacle.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and MARY PILON

lead_paragraph: The challenge for New York Road Runners is how to recover from last week’s race cancellation without too much damage to its finances and reputation.

headline.seo: Hostility Lingers Over Handling of New York City Marathon’s Cancellation
headline.print_headline: Hostility Lingers Over Wittenberg’s Handling of Marathon Cancellation
